elements.description:
A list of history requests in the ARC main menu.

The element uses direct implementation of the PouchDB to make a query to the
datastore. It also listens to events fired by the `arc-model` elements to
update state of the history requests.

### Example
```
<history-menu></history-menu>
```

### Sizing the element

The element uses `<iron-list>` to render the data in the view. The list is set
to be flex vertically. It means that the element has to be sized directly by the
hosting application or otherwise it size will be 0px.

It can be done using flex layout and making the element to be `flex: 1`.

## Changes in version 2

- PouchDB is no longer included into the element. Each platform can have
different implementation of the library so this element will not make
assumtions about the platform.
- The element does not support "opened" attribute. Once inserted into the
DOM it queries datastore.

### Styling
`<history-menu>` provides the following custom properties and mixins for styling:

Custom property | Description | Default
----------------|-------------|----------
`--history-menu` | Mixin applied to the element | `{}`
`--history-menu-background-color` | Background color of the menu | `inherit`
`--history-menu-selected-post-method-color` | Font color of selected item POST method label | `#fff`
`--history-menu-focused-post-method-color` | Font color of focused item POST method label | `rgb(33, 150, 243)`
`--history-menu-selected-method-label-background-color` | Background color of the POST method label when the item is focused | `#fff`
`--history-menu-list` | Mixin applied to the list element. | `{}`
`--history-menu-list-item` | Mixin applied to each list item | `{}`
`--history-menu-selected-item-background-color` | Background color of the selected list item | `#FF9800`
`--history-menu-selected-item-color` | Color of the selected list item | `#fff`
`--history-menu-url-label` | Mixin applied to the URL label | `{}`
`--history-menu-history-group-header` | Mixin applied to the history list group header | `{}`
`--history-menu-history-group-header-font-weigth` | Group header border color | `bold`
`--history-menu-history-group-header-border-color` | Group header border color | `#ddd`
`--history-menu-history-group-header-color` | Font color of the group header` | `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.54)`
`--arc-menu-empty-info-color` | Color applied to the empty info section | ``
`--arc-menu-empty-info-title-color` | Color applied to the title in the empty info section | ``

properties.name: requests
properties.description: The list of request to render.

properties.name: hasRequests
properties.description: Computed value, true when the project has requests.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Requests list type. Can be one of:
- saved
- history
- project

Depending on the the type request change event is handled differently.
For saved and history requests corresponding type is processed.
For project requests list only request that has project id in the
projects list is processed.

This property must be set.

properties.name: projectId
properties.description:
Project datastore ID to display.
This should be set only when type is `project`

properties.name: listType
properties.description:
Changes information density of list items.
By default it uses material's peper item with two lines (72px heigth)
Possible values are:

- `default` or empty - regular list view
- `comfortable` - enables MD single line list item vie (52px heigth)
- `compact` - enables list that has 40px heigth (touch recommended)

properties.name: _hasTwoLines
properties.description:
Computed value if the list item should be consisted of two lines of
description.

properties.name: project
properties.description:
A project object associated with requests.
This is only valid when `type` is project. It is set automatically
when `readProjectRequests()` is called.

properties.name: querying
properties.description: True when the element is querying the database for the data.

properties.name: queryOptions
properties.description:
Computed value.
Database query options for pagination.
Use `pageLimit` to set pagination limit.

properties.name: dataUnavailable
properties.description: Computed value. True if query ended and there's no results.

properties.name: isSearch
properties.description:
When set this component is in search mode.
This means that the list won't be loaded automatically and
some operations not related to search are disabled.

properties.name: searchListEmpty
properties.description:
Computed value. True when the query has been performed and no items
has been returned. It is different from `listHidden` where less
conditions has to be checked. It is set to true when it doesn't
have items, is not loading and is search.

properties.name: noAuto
properties.description: When set it won't query for data automatically when attached to the DOM.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description: Database ID of the selected item.

methods.name: _dispatch
methods.description:
Dispatches bubbling and composed custom event.
By default the event is cancelable until `cancelable` property is set to false.

methods.name: _requestDeletedHandler
methods.description:
Handler for `request-object-deleted` event. Removes request from the list
if it existed.

methods.name: _itemDeleted
methods.description: Removes an item from the list by given id.

methods.name: _historyItemDeleted
methods.description: Removes a history item from the list by given id.

methods.name: _requestChangedHandler
methods.description:
Handler for `request-object-changed` custom event.
Depending on the `type` property it updates / adds / removes item from
the requests list.

methods.name: _projectTypeChanged
methods.description: Handles request change when type is project.

methods.name: _isProjectRequest
methods.description:
Checks if requests is related to current project.
`projectId` has to be set on the element.

methods.name: _savedTypeChanged
methods.description: Handles request change when type is saved or history.

methods.name: _dispatchProjectRead
methods.description: Dispatches `project-read` custom event and returns it.

methods.name: _dispatchProjectList
methods.description: Dispatches `request-project-list` custom event and returns it.

methods.name: _dispatchRequestChanged
methods.description: Dispatches `request-object-changed` custom event and returns it.

methods.name: readProjectRequests
methods.description: A function to read request data for a project.

methods.name: _legacySort
methods.description: Sorts requests list by `projectOrder` property

methods.name: _updateBulk
methods.description: Updates requests in bulk opeartion.

methods.name: _updateRequest
methods.description: Sends the `request-object-changed` custom event for each request on the list.

return.desc: Promise resolved when the request object is updated.

methods.name: _computeHasTwoLines
methods.description: Computes value for `_hasTwoLines` property.

methods.name: _updateListStyles
methods.description:
Updates icon size CSS variable and notifies resize on the list when
list type changes.

methods.name: _persistRequestsOrder
methods.description:
Stores current order of requests in the project.
This shouls be only called wshen `project` property is set.

methods.name: _idsArrayEqual
methods.description: Tests if two arrays has the same order of ids (strings).

return.desc: True when elements are ordered the same way.

methods.name: _dispatchProjectUpdate
methods.description:
Dispatches `project-object-changed` event to inform model to update
the data.

methods.name: _projectChanged
methods.description: Handler for the `project-object-changed` event.

methods.name: _computeQueryOptions
methods.description:
Computes pagination options.
This resets pagination status.

methods.name: _computeDataUnavailable
methods.description: Computes value for the `dataUnavailable` proeprty

methods.name: _computeSearchListEmpty
methods.description: Computes value for the `searchListEmpty` property

methods.name: refresh
methods.description:
Refreshes the data from the datastore.
It resets the query options, clears requests and makes a query to the datastore.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the state of the variables.

methods.name: _dataImportHandler
methods.description:
Handler for `data-imported` cutom event.
Refreshes data state.

methods.name: _onDatabaseDestroy
methods.description:
Handler for the `datastore-destroyed` custom event.
If one of destroyed databases is history store then it refreshes the sate.

methods.name: loadNext
methods.description:
Loads next page of results. It runs the task in a debouncer set to
next render frame so it's safe to call it more than once at the time.

methods.name: _appendItems
methods.description:
Appends array items to the `requests` property.
It should be used instead of direct manipulation of the `items` array.

methods.name: _loadPage
methods.description:
Loads next page of results from the datastore.
Pagination used here has been described in PouchDB pagination strategies
document.

methods.name: _dispatchListEvent
methods.description: Dispatches `request-list` custom event and returns the event.

methods.name: _processHistoryResults
methods.description: Processes query results to generate view data model.

params.name: res
params.description: List of history requests retreived from the datastore.

methods.name: _ensureTimestamps
methods.description:
Ensures that the history objects have the `updated` property
required by further computations while processing results.

return.desc:
The same array but all requests will have `updated`
property.

methods.name: _sortHistoryResults
methods.description: Sorts the query results by `updated` property.

methods.name: _getTodayTimestamp
methods.description: Creates a timestamp fot today, midnight

methods.name: _getYesterdayTimestamp
methods.description: Computes yesterday's midninght based on today's mignight timestamp

params.name: todayTimestamp
params.description: Timestamp of current daty at midnight

methods.name: _groupHistory
methods.description:
Creates headers for each day and group requests in each day group.
This is relevant for history type

methods.name: _computeHistoryTime
methods.description:
Computes time information for a history item. This is later used to
present history list item.

params.name: date
params.description: Timestamp of when the item was created / updated

return.desc:
Various time formats:
- formatted - Formatted date string
- time - Parsed timestamp
- timeLabel - secondary list item

methods.name: _historyTypeChanged
methods.description: Handles request model change when the type is history.

methods.name: _removeItem
methods.description: Removes history item at position.

methods.name: _insertItem
methods.description:
Adds a new history item to the list at a position where its `updated` or
`created` time suggests.

methods.name: _historyInsertPosition
methods.description:
Determines a position of a history item to be inserted at.
The position is determined by `time` argument.
It always returns the position where the item to insert is newer than next item on the list.

return.desc: Position at which insert the request.

methods.name: _appendHistoryTimeHeader
methods.description: Appends time properties to a history item.

methods.name: _resetHistoryObject
methods.description:
Resets history object by removing items that has been added
when processing response.

methods.name: query
methods.description:
Dispatches `request-query` custom event to `request-model`
to perform a query.

params.name: query
params.description:
The query to performs. Pass empty stirng
(or nothing) to reset query state.

return.desc: Resolved promise when the query ends.

methods.name: _dispatchQueryEvent
methods.description:
Dispatches `request-query` custom event.
This event is handled by `request-mode` element to query the
datastore for user search term.

methods.name: _computeItemClass
methods.description: Computes class name for the HTML element representing a history item.

methods.name: _scrollHandler
methods.description:
Called every time the element changed it's scroll position. It will call the `makeQuery`
function when there's less than 120px left to scroll. (also it must be opened and must not
already querying).

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description:
Notifies the list that the resize event occurred.
Should be called whhen content of the list changed but the list wasn't
visible at the time.

methods.name: _openHistory
methods.description: Handler for the `click` event on the item.

elements.name: UiElements.HistoryMenu

attributes.name: requests
attributes.description: The list of request to render.

attributes.name: has-requests
attributes.description: Computed value, true when the project has requests.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description:
Requests list type. Can be one of:
- saved
- history
- project

Depending on the the type request change event is handled differently.
For saved and history requests corresponding type is processed.
For project requests list only request that has project id in the
projects list is processed.

This property must be set.

attributes.name: project-id
attributes.description:
Project datastore ID to display.
This should be set only when type is `project`

attributes.name: list-type
attributes.description:
Changes information density of list items.
By default it uses material's peper item with two lines (72px heigth)
Possible values are:

- `default` or empty - regular list view
- `comfortable` - enables MD single line list item vie (52px heigth)
- `compact` - enables list that has 40px heigth (touch recommended)

attributes.name: project
attributes.description:
A project object associated with requests.
This is only valid when `type` is project. It is set automatically
when `readProjectRequests()` is called.

attributes.name: querying
attributes.description: True when the element is querying the database for the data.

attributes.name: query-options
attributes.description:
Computed value.
Database query options for pagination.
Use `pageLimit` to set pagination limit.

attributes.name: data-unavailable
attributes.description: Computed value. True if query ended and there's no results.

attributes.name: is-search
attributes.description:
When set this component is in search mode.
This means that the list won't be loaded automatically and
some operations not related to search are disabled.

attributes.name: search-list-empty
attributes.description:
Computed value. True when the query has been performed and no items
has been returned. It is different from `listHidden` where less
conditions has to be checked. It is set to true when it doesn't
have items, is not loading and is search.

attributes.name: no-auto
attributes.description: When set it won't query for data automatically when attached to the DOM.

attributes.name: selected-item
attributes.description: Database ID of the selected item.

events.name: request-list
events.description: Dispatched when the element requests next page of results.
